This game is a continuation and escape from City 17 from the previous events of Half-Life 2. It was... good. I personally feel that this should have been in Half-Life 2 and then Episode One focuses on something else. I do still recommend this however.

In my opinion this game is average. It's not a horrible game, but neither the best game of Half Life franchise.  

The story continues the plot of Half Life, but it doesn't progress too much either. The only mission is to escape from citadel and City 17, so you can finish this game in a matter of a day.

I don't have to explain too much about gameplay, since it's the same as in the previous game.

Graphically it's not really different from Half Life 2, but slightlier. Don't forget that Lost Coast (that little adventure from 2005) was a test to try new visuals. 

It has archievements which are really easy to get, and honestly that would be the only reason to replay the game.

I finish saying that if you want to continue the Half Life lore, it worths buying it, but once you got all archievements you can forget about it and continue with Episode 2
